title: Pep Guardiola admits striker Sergio Aguero may not have a future at Manchester City
text:
SERGIO AGUER-GO? Pep Guardiola admits striker Sergio Aguero may not have a future at Manchester City 
Etihad boss says it is impossible to drop Gabriel Jesus, Leroy Sane or Raheem Sterling on current form which leaves the superstar out in the cold By MARTIN BLACKBURN Comments PEP GUARDIOLA admits he does not know if Sergio Aguero has a long-term future with Manchester City. 
The Etihad hero is likely to be benched for the third game in a row at Bournemouth on Monday. Reuters 3 Pep Guardiola admits he may struggle to keep hold of first-team outcast Sergio Aguero 
City insist they do not want to sell him but Guardiola said: “I don’t know what is going to happen. 
“ Sergio knows the intention of his manager and the club. 
“I don’t want to sell him, I want him to stay here for a long time until he decides. 
“When Sergio was banned for seven games we missed him a lot. 
“I know his level and I know what he’s done for this club. “But even in my career I didn’t know what would happen at the end of the season.” 
Guardiola says it is impossible to drop Gabriel Jesus , Leroy Sane or Raheem Sterling on current form. 
The Spanish boss said: “The only reason Sergio has not played the last two games is because Leroy, Gabriel and Raheem have played amazing.” Sergio Aguero scores two and sets up another for Man City against the Baggies
